elements.title: Bethel African Methodist Episcopal Church (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Bethel African Methodist Episcopal Church (pictured) in Springtown, New Jersey, was used by Harriet Tubman to help fugitive slaves escape?

elements.title: Muhammad Musa'ad (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that academic Muhammad Musa'ad was barred from running as a candidate in the Papuan gubernatorial election due to his Arabic ancestry?

elements.title: Damen (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Damen, despite being one of the busiest stations on the Chicago "L", lacks accessibility for the disabled?

elements.title: India: The Modi Question (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the BBC documentary India: The Modi Question, which examines the career of Indian prime minister Narendra Modi, was banned in India?

elements.title: Group 1 of the 1930 World Cup (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Lucien Laurent scored the first goal in FIFA World Cup history during the inaugural game of Group 1 of the 1930 World Cup?

elements.title: Please Miss (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Grace Lavery's autobiography Please Miss discusses her transition but also the "paradigmatic concept of the penis"?

elements.title: the Phoenix radio station (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that the Arizona Coyotes ice hockey team objected to a new host on the Phoenix radio station that carried their games, leading to his removal after a week?

elements.title: Alexis Soyer (Wikipedia — did you know?)
elements.contents: ... that Alexis Soyer's dish of lamb cutlets Reform is still on the menu at the Reform Club?
